This incredible boat houses more than meets the eye after the 1930s steel barge was renovated into a £3.7 million home . 
These pictures show the amazing renovation the live-in barge has undergone from a metal vessel to a luxury home. 
The property, called Matrix Island, is moored on the River Thames in St Katherine's Dock, London. 
And judging by these snaps, it should be snapped up quickly by a lucky buyer - if they can afford the steep price tag to go with it. One of the bedrooms has a projector instead of a TV (Photo: Connors) The houseboat is moored in St Katherine's Dock, London (Photo: Connors) It looks more like a plush penthouse inside than an old boat (Photo: Connors) 
It boasts a 50ft deck at the front of the boat with views of the London skyline to entertain guests. 
The boat also has five bedrooms, each with an en-suite, and an indoor sauna. Read More The 1930s steel barge has been stripped bare and redeveloped (Photo: Connors) The interiors of the houseboat are finished to a high standard (Photo: Connors) One of the bedrooms has a projector instead of a TV (Photo: Connors) 
Interiors are kitted out in wooden cladding, white walls and luxurious fabrics. 
There is also a jet-ski platform for fans of watersports. Read More It boasts five en-suite bathrooms and a sauna inside (Photo: Connors) The 50ft decking has incredible views of the London skyline (Photo: Connors) The decking can also be used for games such as trampolines and a tennis table (Photo: Connors) 
The property is on the market for a cool £3.7million, making it one of the most expensive houseboats in Britain. Like us on Facebook
